words.definition: Showing excessive attention to detail or minor points; fussy, snobbish, or over-particular.
The intense, involuntary emotional state of being infatuated with someone, often characterized by obsessive thoughts and fantasies about the person.
Idealistic to an impractical degree; extravagantly chivalrous or romantic, often without regard for reality or practicality.
Given to shedding tears; mournful or tending to cause tears.
To deliberately make something unclear or confusing, often with the intention of deceiving or hiding the truth.
A change or variation occurring in the course of something's development or existence; ups and downs or natural fluctuations in life.
The occurrence of fortunate events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
The pleasant, earthy smell that arises when rain falls on dry soil or rocks, especially after a period of warm and dry weather.
A soft, murmuring, or rustling sound, often like a whisper or a gentle breeze through leaves.
Having a smooth, flowing, and musical sound; sweetly or smoothly flowing.
Denoting a period of peace, tranquility, and happiness; calm, prosperous, and carefree.
Occurring or recurring daily; commonplace, ordinary, or mundane.
The name of a river in the northeastern United States, flowing through Pennsylvania and Maryland.
Excessively fond of or devoted to one's wife; showing an uncommonly submissive or doting behavior towards a spouse.
The process of bubbling or fizzing, usually resulting from the release of gas; vivacity, enthusiasm, or high spirits.
Having a harmful or detrimental effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way; injurious or destructive.
Lasting for a very short time; transient, fleeting, or momentary.
Characterized by the use of long words; having many syllables; tending to use long, complex words.
The quality of having a smooth, flowing, and pleasing sound; melodiousness.
Agile, graceful, and lithely flexible; characterized by effortless and elegant movements.
Nearness in place or time; proximity or close relationship.
A pleasing and harmonious sound, especially in language or music.
Vanishing or fading away like vapor; transient, fleeting, or impermanent.
Spoken or done without preparation; impromptu, improvised, or unrehearsed.
Relating to the countryside or rural life; idyllic, rustic, or pastoral.
Possessing great physical beauty; breathtakingly lovely or attractive.
Inclined to complain or find fault; whiny, petulant, or peevish.
Next to the last in a sequence; second to the end.
Producing or yielding honey; honey-bearing.
Favorable or auspicious; presenting favorable conditions or opportunities.
Transitory written or printed matter that is not meant to be retained or preserved; short-lived documents or items.
To confuse, disconcert, or frustrate; to upset or bewilder.
A person who collaborates with an enemy occupying force, especially to further their own interests; a traitor or collaborator.
Pleasing to the ear; melodious, soothing, or sweet-sounding.
A soft, gentle breeze; a mild or refreshing wind.
The state or a period of flowering or blossoming; a period of peak development or prosperity.
Essentially different or dissimilar; not able to be compared or grouped together easily.
To obscure or cloud something, especially ideas or perceptions; to make hazy or indistinct.
Keen insight or discernment; the ability to understand things quickly and accurately.
Beyond description in words; too extraordinary or overwhelming to be expressed or described.
A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds; a noisy or chaotic cacophony can be unpleasant.
Displaying a play of lustrous, changing colors like those of the rainbow.
The ringing or sound of bells; the act of ringing bells.
An insect that has a very short lifespan, usually lasting only for a day.
Full of or subject to changes, especially those related to fortune or circumstances.
The purest or most perfect embodiment of something; the most essential and fundamental nature of something.
A state of weakness, weariness, or listlessness; lack of energy or vitality.
Looking or sounding sad and mournful; often to an exaggerated or ridiculous degree.
A fine, filmy substance made of cobwebs, floating in the air or spread on plants; something light, delicate, or insubstantial.
Relating to or resembling a peaceful and idyllic time; halcyon.
Cheerful and full of energy; exuberant or overflowing with enthusiasm.
A soft, murmuring, or rustling sound, like the whispering of leaves or a gentle breeze.
The act of making something unclear or confusing, often with the intention of deceiving or obscuring the truth.
Something that attracts attention or serves as a focal point; an object or person that is the center of admiration or interest.
In a mournful, gloomy, or melancholic manner; expressing sadness or sorrow.
Having a pleasing and musical sound; sweetly resonant or melodious.
The state of being too great, intense, or overwhelming to be expressed or described in words.
Of or pertaining to life; living or vital.
Shining brilliantly; radiating light or brightness.
To make something short-lived or transitory; to cause something to last for a brief period.
Characterized by soft murmuring or rustling sounds; whispering or murmuring gently.
Marked by loud and insistent shouting or outcry; clamorous or vehement.
In a daily or commonplace manner; occurring or done regularly or routinely.
A sudden outburst of emotion or energy; a boiling or bubbling up of a liquid.
In a breathtakingly beautiful or attractive manner; with great physical beauty.
The act of clouding, obscuring, or making hazy; the state of being obscured or indistinct.
In an extravagantly chivalrous or idealistic manner, often without regard for reality or practicality.
In a pleasing and melodious manner; with a sweet and harmonious sound.
Relating to or resembling a peaceful and idyllic time; halcyon.
The quality or state of being rustic, pastoral, or idyllic; characteristic of the countryside or rural life.
The quality or state of being harmful, malicious, or detrimental; causing serious harm or damage.
Inclined to complain or find fault; given to habitual or constant complaining.
The use of long and complicated words; a tendency to use long and obscure words.
A blurred, hazy, or radiant effect surrounding a bright light, especially in photography.
The quality of having a smooth, flowing, and pleasing sound; melodiousness.
Enthusiasm, cheerfulness, and high spirits; overflowing with energy and excitement.
Agile, graceful, and flexible; characterized by effortless and elegant movements.
Unclear, vague, or ill-defined; lacking definite form or limits.
The act of making something unclear or confusing, often with the intention of deceiving or obscuring the truth.
Inclined to complain or find fault; whiny, petulant, or peevish.
Characterized by whispering or murmuring sounds; softly rustling or susurrating.
Vanishing or fading away like vapor; transient, fleeting, or impermanent.
Idealistic to an impractical degree; extravagantly chivalrous or romantic, often without regard for reality or practicality.
A soft, gentle breeze; a mild or refreshing wind.
Spoken or done without preparation; impromptu, improvised, or unrehearsed.
Occurring or recurring daily; commonplace, ordinary, or mundane.
Sweet and smooth-sounding, typically used to describe voices or music with a pleasant and flowing quality.
Characterized by the use of long words; having many syllables; tending to use long, complex words.
Having a harmful or detrimental effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way; injurious or destructive.
Lasting for a very short time; transient, fleeting, or momentary.
A change or variation occurring in the course of something's development or existence; ups and downs or natural fluctuations in life.
The pleasant, earthy smell that arises when rain falls on dry soil or rocks, especially after a period of warm and dry weather.
A full day and night cycle; a 24-hour period consisting of day and night.
The period of evening; the time of dusk or sunset.
Proceeding by inquiry or investigation; engaging in a search or quest for knowledge.
A small, unexpected gift or gratuity given to a customer; a bonus or extra present.
Wandering or roaming around at night; traveling or moving about during the nighttime.
